intro.description:
Using Dojo VJET JS Type Library
This tutorial will show you how to:
- load a type library as an Eclipse Project
- create a project which depends on this type library
- show code assist, validation, and searching with type library for the Dojo APIs.

item.title: Open the VJET JS perspective
item.description: If you're not already in the VJET JS perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > VJET JS or click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Go To the VJET Type library download page:
item.description: Go to the VJET Js Type library download page.

item.title: Download the Dojo Type library
item.description: Locate and select the Dojo type library zip file located on the download page.

item.title: Import the Dojo Type library
item.description:
Import the Type library as an Eclipse project using:
Use the File > Import Existing Projects Into workspace. Select Import from archive and Browse location of archive.

item.title: Create a VJET JS Project
item.description: Before creating a JavaScript File, we need a project to put it in and set up a dependency. In the main toolbar, click on the New VJET JS Project button, or click on the link below. Enter HelloDojo for the project name, then click Next. Go to the Projects tab and add the Dojo Type library project to the list of dependencies.

item.title: Create your Hello Dojo Js File
item.description:
The next step is to create a new JS file In the main toolbar again, click on the New JavaScript Source File button (or the link below). If not already specified, select HelloDojo/src as the source folder. Enter HelloDojo for the file name, then click Finish.
The VJET JS editor will automatically open showing your new JavaScript file.
Type d and then control + space. You will see dojo proposed.
